title: Check Palindrome
description: Determine if a given string is a palindrome (reads the same forwards and backwards, ignoring case and non-alphanumeric characters).

examples.input_value: 'A man a plan a canal Panama'
examples.explanation: After cleaning and lowercasing, the string is 'amanaplanacanalpanama', which is a palindrome.

hints: Pre-process the string: convert to lowercase and remove all non-alphanumeric characters.
Compare the cleaned string to its reversed version.
solution_code:
import re

def is_palindrome(text):
    # 1. Convert to lowercase
    text = text.lower()
    
    # 2. Remove all non-alphanumeric characters (including spaces)
    clean_text = re.sub(r'[^a-z0-9]', '', text)
    
    # 3. Compare with reversed string
    return clean_text == clean_text[::-1]

input: A man a plan a canal Panama
